content:
All that can really be done is communicating as best as possible what the state is: the cessation of emotional relationship to a self-concept. 

It isn't possible to prevent someone from imagining whatever they want to imagine and believing it to be a true achievement they may one day experience, which creates an emotional ambition in their own mind. Ironically, it's this operation that stops entirely, but it is not obvious when you're in it. 

Like everything, it is up to the individual to come to their own understanding. If I were to say "there is no Heaven or Hell" the way someone responds might be "Oh, that means I can do whatever I want without consequences!" which is of course not the intended meaning of that statement, but there isn't much else you can do other than being like "hey, hold up that's not really what I meant".
